alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe; Kipahulu; Lanai Leeward; Lanai Mauka; Lanai South; Lanai Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Central Valley South; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West; Molokai Leeward South; Molokai North; Molokai Southeast; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; South Haleakala; South Maui, Upcountry; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued July 18 at 11:20AM HST until July 19 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6PM HST THIS EVENING FOR MAUI COUNTY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY FOR MAUI COUNTY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY FOR OAHU AND KAUAI... .Winds will steadily strengthen today through tonight as Tropical Storm Calvin passes near the Big Island and south of the smaller islands tonight. Damaging winds will be possible especially over Maui County. The strongest winds will likely occur in areas over and downwind of terrain. ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northeast winds 30 to 45 mph with localized gusts of 60 mph expected. For the Wind Advisory, northeast winds 20 to 40 mph with localized gusts of 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Kahoolawe, Lanai, Maui and Molokai. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 6 PM this evening to 6 PM HST Wednesday. For the Wind Advisory, until 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds may blow down trees and power lines and damage roofs. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Strong winds may lead to property damage. Hazardous driving conditions due to powerful cross winds will pose a serious risk for drivers, especially for light weight and high profile vehicles. Loose outdoor items should be brought inside or secured properly.
